Full Curriculum Vitae upon request.
EDUCATION:

    PhD. | Computer Science, University of California Irvine, CA, USA, 2014 - present
    M.S. | Computer Science, University of Texas at Dallas, TX, USA, 2011 - 2013
HONORS & AWARDS :
  • People's Choice Award, Graduate Research Symposium, UCI  [2018]
  • NSF Travel Grant for ACM MobiHoc Conference  [2018]
  • SIGMETRICS Travel Grant for ACM SIGMETRICS Conference  [2018]
  • Selected among 8 teams nationwide for DARPA SDR Hackfest  [2017]
  • Best Poster Award in Computer Science Research Showcase, UCI [2016]
  • Third best poster award in Intern Research Showcase at Huawei Research Labs, CA [2016]
  • Graduate Fellowship from Computer Science dept. of UC Irvine. [2014]
  • Certificate of Academic Excellence, Computer Science Department, UT Dallas [2013]
  • Nominated for membership in "Golden Key International Honour Society" by UT Dallas. [2012]
  • 5th Place in Cyber Security and ethical hacking at TexSAW at UT Dallas. [2011]
  • Ranked 2nd (all departments) in the undergraduate institution. [2007]
INDUSTRY EXPERIENCE :
  • Research Intern | Nokia Bell Labs, UAVs over Edge-Cloud, Murray Hill, NJ  [Jun.'17 - Sep.'17]
  • Research Intern | Huawei Research Labs, Network Virtualization Group, CA  [Jun.'16 - Sep.'16]
  • Software Engineer | Cisco Systems, Software Routing Group for 3G/4G, CA  [Sep.'13 - Sep.'14]
  • Software Developer Intern | BlackBerry Ltd., Radio Applications R&D, TX  [Jan.'13 - May'13]
  • Senior System Engineer | IBM, Telecom Group, Noida, India  [Sept.'07 - Jun.'11]
ACADEMIC RESEARCH EXPERIENCE :
  • Research Assistant | Intelligent & Autonomous Sys. Lab, UCI | Adviser: Dr. Marco Levorato [Sep.'14 - present]
  • Research Student | Distributed Systems Lab, UT Dallas, TX | Adviser: Dr. Ravi Prakash [Sep.'11 - Aug.'13]
  • Research Intern | WINLAB, Rutgers University, NJ | Adviser: Dr. Dipankar Raychaudhuri [May'12 - Aug.'12]
TEACHING EXPERIENCE  :

Graduate Teaching Assistant, University of California, Irvine, CA
  • Advanced Computer Networks Lab (CS 233, 133)  [Winter '16]
  • Computer Communications Networks (CS 232)  [Fall '15]
  • Introductory Python Programming (ICS 31)  [Summer '15]
  • Programming Data Structures with C/C++ (ICS 45C)  [Spring '15]
  • Programming with Software Library in Python (ICS 32)  [Winter '15]
Teaching Assistant, University of Texas at Dallas, TX
  • Java Programming course (CS 1331)   [Fall '11]
